docs.title: Medical Calculator MCP Server
docs.text: 🏥 **121 Validated Medical Calculators for AI Agents**  [![Python 3.11+](https://img.shields.io/badge/python-3.11+-blue.svg)](https://www.python.org/downloads/) [![MCP SDK](https://img.shields.io/badge/MCP-FastMCP-green.svg)](https://github.com/modelcontextprotocol/python-sdk) [![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-Apache%202.0-blue.svg)](https://github.com/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp/blob/main/LICENSE) [![Tests](https://img.shields.io/badge/tests-1721%20passed-brightgreen.svg)](https://github.com/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp)

docs.title: 🎯 What is this?
docs.text:
Medical-Calc-MCP is a Model Context Protocol (MCP) server that provides 121 validated medical calculators for AI agents like Claude, GPT, and other LLMs.

Clinical Disclaimer

This tool is for educational and research purposes. Always verify calculations with clinical judgment and institutional protocols.

docs.title: ✨ Key Features
docs.text:
• :material-calculator:{ .lg .middle } 121 Clinical Calculators

    Evidence-based formulas across 16+ medical specialties with peer-reviewed citations

  • :material-robot:{ .lg .middle } MCP Native

    Built with FastMCP SDK for seamless AI agent integration

  • :material-magnify:{ .lg .middle } Intelligent Discovery

    Two-level key system for smart tool selection by context

  • :material-shield-check:{ .lg .middle } Validated & Safe

    Boundary validation with literature-backed clinical ranges

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
📊 Specialty Coverage
docs.text: Specialty Calculators Examples Critical Care 15+ SOFA, APACHE II, qSOFA, NEWS2 Cardiology 12+ CHA₂DS₂-VASc, HEART, TIMI Nephrology 8+ CKD-EPI, KDIGO AKI Anesthesiology 10+ ASA-PS, Mallampati, STOP-BANG Psychiatry 7 PHQ-9, GAD-7, HAM-D Geriatrics 6 MMSE, MoCA, Barthel Index ... ... See all →

docs.title: 📖 Documentation
docs.text:
• Getting Started - Installation and setup
  • Calculator Reference - All 121 calculators
  • API Reference - MCP tools and REST API
  • Architecture - DDD design principles

docs.title: 🤝 Contributing
docs.text: Contributions are welcome! See our Contributing Guide.

docs.title: 📜 License
docs.text: Apache 2.0 - See LICENSE

docs.title: MCP Tools Reference
docs.text: Medical-Calc-MCP exposes tools via the Model Context Protocol (MCP).

docs.title: list_specialties
docs.text:
List all available medical specialties.

{
  "tool": "list_specialties"
}

Returns: Array of specialty names with calculator counts.

docs.title: list_contexts
docs.text:
List all clinical contexts.

{
  "tool": "list_contexts"
}

docs.title: list_by_specialty
docs.text:
Get calculators for a specific specialty.

{
  "tool": "list_by_specialty",
  "params": {
    "specialty": "critical_care"
  }
}

docs.title: list_by_context
docs.text:
Get calculators for a clinical context.

{
  "tool": "list_by_context",
  "params": {
    "context": "sepsis_evaluation"
  }
}

docs.title: search_calculators
docs.text:
Search calculators by keyword.

{
  "tool": "search_calculators",
  "params": {
    "keyword": "cardiac risk"
  }
}

docs.title: get_calculator_info
docs.text:
Get detailed info about a calculator.

{
  "tool": "get_calculator_info",
  "params": {
    "tool_id": "sofa_score"
  }
}

Returns: - Name, purpose - Required parameters with descriptions - References with PMID

docs.title: get_related_tools
docs.text:
Find calculators related to a given tool.

{
  "tool": "get_related_tools",
  "params": {
    "tool_id": "chads2_vasc"
  }
}

docs.title: calculate
docs.text:
Execute a calculation.

{
  "tool": "calculate",
  "params": {
    "tool_id": "ckd_epi_2021",
    "serum_creatinine": 1.2,
    "age": 65,
    "sex": "male"
  }
}

Returns: 

{
  "success": true,
  "score_name": "CKD-EPI 2021 eGFR",
  "result": 62.5,
  "unit": "mL/min/1.73m²",
  "interpretation": {
    "summary": "CKD Stage 2",
    "severity": "mild",
    "recommendations": [...]
  },
  "references": [...]
}

docs.title: calculate_batch
docs.text:
Execute multiple calculations at once.

{
  "tool": "calculate_batch",
  "params": {
    "calculations": [
      {"tool_id": "qsofa_score", "params": {...}},
      {"tool_id": "sofa_score", "params": {...}}
    ]
  }
}

docs.title: Parameter Matching
docs.text:
The calculate tool supports intelligent parameter matching:

Feature Example Aliases cr → serum_creatinine Fuzzy match creatnine → creatinine Unit suffix creatinine_mg_dl → creatinine

docs.title: Boundary Validation
docs.text:
All calculations include clinical boundary validation:

{
  "result": 45.2,
  "_boundary_warnings": [
    {
      "parameter": "creatinine",
      "value": 8.5,
      "message": "Value above typical clinical range (0.5-4.0 mg/dL)",
      "reference": "PMID: 19414839"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: REST API Reference
docs.text: Medical-Calc-MCP also provides a REST API for non-MCP integrations.

docs.title: Base URL
docs.text: http://localhost:8000/api/v1

docs.title: Authentication
docs.text:
When SECURITY_API_KEY is configured:

curl -H "X-API-Key: your-api-key" http://localhost:8000/api/v1/...

docs.title: Health Check
docs.text:
GET /health

Response: 

{
  "status": "healthy",
  "version": "1.5.0",
  "calculators": 121
}

docs.title: List All Calculators
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/calculators

Response: 

{
  "calculators": [
    {
      "tool_id": "sofa_score",
      "name": "SOFA Score",
      "specialty": "critical_care"
    },
    ...
  ],
  "total": 121
}

docs.title: Get Calculator Details
docs.text:
GET /api/v1/calculators/{tool_id}

Example: 

curl http://localhost:8000/api/v1/calculators/ckd_epi_2021

Response: 

{
  "tool_id": "ckd_epi_2021",
  "name": "CKD-EPI 2021 eGFR",
  "purpose": "Estimate glomerular filtration rate",
  "parameters": [
    {
      "name": "serum_creatinine",
      "type": "number",
      "required": true,
      "description": "Serum creatinine in mg/dL"
    },
    ...
  ],
  "references": [...]
}

docs.title: Calculate
docs.text:
POST /api/v1/calculate/{tool_id}

Request: 

curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/calculate/ckd_epi_2021 \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "serum_creatinine": 1.2,
    "age": 65,
    "sex": "male"
  }'

Response: 

{
  "success": true,
  "score_name": "CKD-EPI 2021 eGFR",
  "result": 62.5,
  "unit": "mL/min/1.73m²",
  "interpretation": {
    "summary": "CKD Stage 2 (Mildly decreased)",
    "severity": "mild",
    "stage": "G2",
    "recommendations": [
      "Monitor kidney function annually",
      "Optimize cardiovascular risk factors"
    ]
  },
  "references": [
    {
      "citation": "Inker LA, et al. N Engl J Med. 2021;385(19):1737-1749",
      "pmid": "34554658"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Batch Calculate
docs.text:
POST /api/v1/calculate/batch

Request: 

{
  "calculations": [
    {
      "tool_id": "qsofa_score",
      "params": {
        "respiratory_rate": 24,
        "systolic_bp": 95,
        "altered_mentation": true
      }
    },
    {
      "tool_id": "sofa_score",
      "params": {...}
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: 400 Bad Request
docs.text:
{
  "error": "validation_error",
  "message": "Missing required parameter: serum_creatinine",
  "details": {
    "missing_params": ["serum_creatinine"]
  }
}

docs.title: 404 Not Found
docs.text:
{
  "error": "not_found",
  "message": "Calculator 'invalid_tool' not found"
}

docs.title: 429 Too Many Requests
docs.text:
{
  "error": "rate_limited",
  "message": "Rate limit exceeded. Try again in 60 seconds."
}

docs.title: OpenAPI Documentation
docs.text:
When running the server, access interactive API docs:

  • Swagger UI: http://localhost:8000/docs
  • ReDoc: http://localhost:8000/redoc

docs.title: Calculator Overview
docs.text: Medical-Calc-MCP provides 121 validated medical calculators across 16+ specialties.

docs.title: By Specialty
docs.text: Specialty Count Link Critical Care / ICU 15+ View → Cardiology 12+ View → Nephrology 8+ View → Anesthesiology 10+ View → Pulmonology 8+ Coming soon Neurology 6+ View → Hepatology 5+ View → Hematology 5+ Coming soon Emergency Medicine 8+ Coming soon Psychiatry 7 View → Dermatology 5 Coming soon Endocrinology 5 Coming soon Urology 4 Coming soon OB/GYN 5 Coming soon Geriatrics 6 View → Oncology 3 Coming soon

docs.title: Calculator Structure
docs.text:
Each calculator provides:

  • Score/Value: The calculated result
  • Interpretation: Clinical meaning and severity
  • Recommendations: Evidence-based next steps
  • References: Original papers with PMID

docs.title: Example Output
docs.text:
{
  "value": 45.2,
  "unit": "mL/min/1.73m²",
  "interpretation": {
    "summary": "CKD Stage 3b",
    "severity": "moderate",
    "recommendations": [
      "Monitor kidney function every 3-6 months",
      "Refer to nephrology"
    ]
  },
  "references": [
    {
      "citation": "Levey AS, et al. N Engl J Med. 2009;361:2279-90",
      "pmid": "19920272"
    }
  ]
}

docs.title: Via MCP (AI Agents)
docs.text:
User: Calculate SOFA score for a patient with:
- PaO2/FiO2 = 200, mechanically ventilated
- Platelets = 80
- Bilirubin = 2.5
- MAP = 65 on norepinephrine
- GCS = 13
- Creatinine = 2.0

AI: [Calls calculate("sofa_score", {...})]
→ SOFA Score = 10, indicating severe organ dysfunction

docs.title: Via REST API
docs.text:
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/calculate/sofa_score \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{
    "pao2_fio2_ratio": 200,
    "is_mechanically_ventilated": true,
    "platelets": 80,
    "bilirubin": 2.5,
    "map_value": 65,
    "vasopressor": "norepinephrine",
    "gcs_score": 13,
    "creatinine": 2.0
  }'

docs.title: Anesthesiology Calculators
docs.text: Preoperative assessment and perioperative risk stratification tools.

docs.title: ASA Physical Status
docs.text:
Tool ID: asa_physical_status

Class Definition Example ASA I Healthy Healthy, non-smoking ASA II Mild systemic disease Well-controlled DM, HTN, obesity ASA III Severe systemic disease Poorly controlled DM, COPD on home O₂ ASA IV Life-threatening disease Recent MI, sepsis, DIC ASA V Moribund Ruptured AAA, massive trauma ASA VI Brain death Organ donor

Add "E" suffix for emergency surgery.

docs.title: RCRI (Revised Cardiac Risk Index)
docs.text:
Cardiac risk for non-cardiac surgery.

Tool ID: rcri

Risk Factors (1 point each): 1. High-risk surgery (intrathoracic, intraperitoneal, suprainguinal vascular) 2. Ischemic heart disease 3. Heart failure 4. Cerebrovascular disease 5. Insulin-dependent diabetes 6. Creatinine >2.0 mg/dL

Points Cardiac Event Risk 0 0.4% 1 0.9% 2 6.6% ≥3 11%

docs.title: Mallampati Score
docs.text:
Tool ID: mallampati_score

Class View I Full uvula, tonsils, soft palate II Upper uvula, soft palate III Soft and hard palate only IV Hard palate only

Higher class = higher intubation difficulty risk.

docs.title: STOP-BANG
docs.text:
OSA screening.

Tool ID: stop_bang

Criterion Snoring Loud snoring Tired Daytime fatigue Observed Witnessed apnea Pressure Hypertension BMI >35 kg/m² Age >50 years Neck >40 cm (male), >38 cm (female) Gender Male Score OSA Risk 0-2 Low 3-4 Intermediate 5-8 High

docs.title: Aldrete Score
docs.text:
Post-anesthesia recovery assessment.

Tool ID: aldrete_score

Parameter 0 1 2 Activity Unable Moves 2 extremities Moves 4 extremities Respiration Apneic Dyspnea Deep breath, cough Circulation BP ±50% BP ±20-50% BP ±20% Consciousness Unresponsive Arousable Fully awake O₂ Saturation <90% 90-92% >92%

Score ≥9 typically required for PACU discharge.

docs.title: MABL (Maximum Allowable Blood Loss)
docs.text:
Tool ID: mabl

Calculates maximum blood loss before transfusion needed.

Parameters: - Estimated blood volume - Starting hematocrit - Minimum acceptable hematocrit

docs.title: Other Anesthesiology Tools
docs.text: Tool ID Purpose Caprini VTE caprini_vte VTE prophylaxis ARISCAT ariscat Pulmonary complications NSQIP nsqip Surgical risk Parkland parkland_formula Burn resuscitation

docs.title: Cardiology Calculators
docs.text: Calculators for cardiovascular risk assessment and management.

docs.title: CHA₂DS₂-VASc Score
docs.text:
Stroke risk in atrial fibrillation.

Tool ID: chads2_vasc

Factor Points Congestive heart failure 1 Hypertension 1 Age ≥75 2 Diabetes 1 Stroke/TIA/thromboembolism 2 Vascular disease 1 Age 65-74 1 Sex (female) 1

Anticoagulation Recommendations:

Score Risk Recommendation 0 (male) / 1 (female) Low No anticoagulation 1 (male) Moderate Consider anticoagulation ≥2 High Anticoagulation recommended

docs.title: HAS-BLED Score
docs.text:
Bleeding risk with anticoagulation.

Tool ID: has_bled

Clinical Pearl

Always calculate both CHA₂DS₂-VASc AND HAS-BLED for AF patients

Factor Points Hypertension (uncontrolled) 1 Abnormal renal/liver function 1-2 Stroke 1 Bleeding history 1 Labile INR 1 Elderly (>65) 1 Drugs/Alcohol 1-2

docs.title: HEART Score
docs.text:
Risk stratification for chest pain.

Tool ID: heart_score

Component 0 1 2 History Slightly suspicious Moderately suspicious Highly suspicious ECG Normal Non-specific changes Significant ST deviation Age <45 45-64 ≥65 Risk factors None 1-2 ≥3 or known CAD Troponin Normal 1-3× normal >3× normal

Risk Stratification: - 0-3: Low risk (1.7% MACE) - 4-6: Intermediate risk (16.6% MACE) - 7-10: High risk (50.1% MACE)

docs.title: TIMI Risk Score (STEMI)
docs.text:
Tool ID: timi_stemi

Mortality prediction after STEMI.

docs.title: TIMI Risk Score (NSTEMI/UA)
docs.text:
Tool ID: timi_nstemi

14-day risk of death, MI, or urgent revascularization.

docs.title: NYHA Functional Class
docs.text:
Tool ID: nyha_class

Class Description I No limitation II Slight limitation III Marked limitation IV Symptoms at rest

docs.title: Other Cardiology Tools
docs.text: Tool ID Purpose Wells PE wells_pe PE probability Wells DVT wells_dvt DVT probability GRACE Score grace_score ACS mortality Framingham framingham 10-year CVD risk ASCVD Risk ascvd_risk Atherosclerotic CVD risk

docs.title: Critical Care Calculators
docs.text: Calculators for ICU assessment, organ dysfunction, and severity scoring.

docs.title: SOFA Score (Sequential Organ Failure Assessment)
docs.text:
Sepsis-3 Criterion

SOFA ≥2 with suspected infection = Sepsis

Tool ID: sofa_score

Parameter Range PaO2/FiO2 ratio Required Platelets (×10⁹/L) Required Bilirubin (mg/dL) Required MAP or vasopressors Required GCS Required Creatinine (mg/dL) Required

Reference: Singer M, et al. JAMA. 2016;315(8):801-810. PMID: 26903338

docs.title: qSOFA (Quick SOFA)
docs.text:
Bedside screening for sepsis outside the ICU.

Tool ID: qsofa_score

Parameter Criteria Respiratory rate ≥22/min Systolic BP ≤100 mmHg Altered mentation GCS <15

Interpretation: - Score ≥2: High risk, consider ICU admission - Score <2: Low risk, but doesn't exclude sepsis

docs.title: APACHE II
docs.text:
Mortality prediction for ICU patients.

Tool ID: apache_ii

Parameters: Age, temperature, MAP, heart rate, respiratory rate, oxygenation, pH, sodium, potassium, creatinine, hematocrit, WBC, GCS, chronic health status

Reference: Knaus WA, et al. Crit Care Med. 1985;13(10):818-829. PMID: 3928249

docs.title: NEWS2 (National Early Warning Score 2)
docs.text:
Tool ID: news2_score

Score Risk Action 0-4 Low Routine monitoring 5-6 Medium Urgent review ≥7 High Emergency response

docs.title: RASS (Richmond Agitation-Sedation Scale)
docs.text:
Tool ID: rass

Score Description +4 Combative +3 Very agitated +2 Agitated +1 Restless 0 Alert and calm -1 Drowsy -2 Light sedation -3 Moderate sedation -4 Deep sedation -5 Unarousable

docs.title: CAM-ICU (Confusion Assessment Method for ICU)
docs.text:
Tool ID: cam_icu

Prerequisite

Requires RASS ≥-3 to assess

Features assessed: 1. Acute onset or fluctuating course 2. Inattention 3. Altered level of consciousness 4. Disorganized thinking

docs.title: Other Critical Care Tools
docs.text: Tool ID Purpose GCS glasgow_coma_scale Consciousness assessment SAPS II saps_ii Mortality prediction APACHE IV apache_iv Updated mortality model MODS mods_score Multiple organ dysfunction PIM3 pim3 Pediatric ICU mortality PEWS pews Pediatric early warning

docs.title: Geriatrics Calculators
docs.text: Tools for comprehensive geriatric assessment including cognitive, functional, nutritional, and frailty evaluation.

docs.title: MMSE (Mini-Mental State Examination)
docs.text:
The gold standard for cognitive screening.

Tool ID: mmse

Domain Max Points Orientation (time) 5 Orientation (place) 5 Registration 3 Attention/Calculation 5 Recall 3 Language 8 Visuospatial 1 Total 30

Interpretation:

Score Interpretation 24-30 Normal 20-23 Mild cognitive impairment 10-19 Moderate cognitive impairment <10 Severe cognitive impairment

Education Adjustment

Consider education level when interpreting scores

docs.title: MoCA (Montreal Cognitive Assessment)
docs.text:
More sensitive than MMSE for mild cognitive impairment.

Tool ID: moca

Domains assessed: - Visuospatial/Executive - Naming - Memory - Attention - Language - Abstraction - Delayed recall - Orientation

Interpretation: - ≥26: Normal - <26: Cognitive impairment (add 1 point if ≤12 years education)

docs.title: Barthel Index (ADL)
docs.text:
Assessment of activities of daily living.

Tool ID: barthel_index

Activity Score Range Feeding 0-10 Bathing 0-5 Grooming 0-5 Dressing 0-10 Bowel control 0-10 Bladder control 0-10 Toilet use 0-10 Transfers 0-15 Mobility 0-15 Stairs 0-10 Total 0-100

Interpretation: - 100: Independent - 80-99: Minimal dependence - 60-79: Mild dependence - 40-59: Moderate dependence - 20-39: Severe dependence - <20: Total dependence

docs.title: TUG (Timed Up and Go)
docs.text:
Simple mobility and fall risk assessment.

Tool ID: tug

Procedure: Time (in seconds) to rise from chair, walk 3 meters, turn, walk back, sit down.

Time Interpretation <10s Normal 10-14s Mildly impaired 14-20s Moderate impairment, increased fall risk >20s Severe impairment, high fall risk

docs.title: Clinical Frailty Scale (CFS)
docs.text:
Tool ID: cfs

Score Category Description 1 Very fit Robust, exercises regularly 2 Well Less robust, occasional activity 3 Managing well Medical problems controlled 4 Vulnerable Not dependent but slowed down 5 Mildly frail Needs help with IADLs 6 Moderately frail Needs help with ADLs 7 Severely frail Completely dependent 8 Very severely frail Near end of life 9 Terminally ill Life expectancy <6 months

docs.title: MNA (Mini Nutritional Assessment)
docs.text:
Tool ID: mna

Screening for malnutrition risk in elderly patients.

Score Status ≥12 Normal nutritional status 8-11 At risk of malnutrition <8 Malnourished

Screening Questions: - Food intake decline - Weight loss - Mobility - Psychological stress - Neuropsychological problems - BMI or calf circumference

docs.title: Hepatology Calculators
docs.text: Tools for liver disease assessment and prognosis.

docs.title: Child-Pugh Score
docs.text:
Tool ID: child_pugh

Classification of cirrhosis severity.

Parameter 1 point 2 points 3 points Bilirubin (mg/dL) <2 2-3 >3 Albumin (g/dL) >3.5 2.8-3.5 <2.8 INR <1.7 1.7-2.3 >2.3 Ascites None Mild Moderate-severe Encephalopathy None Grade 1-2 Grade 3-4

Classification:

Class Points 1-year Survival A 5-6 100% B 7-9 80% C 10-15 45%

docs.title: MELD Score
docs.text:
Tool ID: meld_score

Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (transplant prioritization).

Formula: 

MELD = 10 × (0.957 × ln(Cr) + 0.378 × ln(Bili) + 1.12 × ln(INR) + 0.643)

Parameters: - Creatinine (mg/dL) - Bilirubin (mg/dL) - INR

Transplant Listing

Higher MELD = higher transplant priority

docs.title: MELD-Na
docs.text:
Tool ID: meld_na

MELD with sodium correction (better mortality prediction).

Formula includes sodium (125-137 mEq/L range capped).

docs.title: MELD 3.0
docs.text:
Tool ID: meld_3

Latest version incorporating sex and albumin.

docs.title: Maddrey's Discriminant Function
docs.text:
Tool ID: maddrey_df

Severity of alcoholic hepatitis.

Formula: 

DF = 4.6 × (PT - control PT) + Bilirubin

DF Severity Treatment <32 Mild-moderate Supportive ≥32 Severe Consider steroids

docs.title: Lille Model
docs.text:
Tool ID: lille_model

Response to steroids in alcoholic hepatitis (assessed at day 7).

Score Interpretation <0.45 Responder - continue steroids ≥0.45 Non-responder - stop steroids

docs.title: Other Hepatology Tools
docs.text: Tool ID Purpose ABIC Score abic_score Alcoholic hepatitis prognosis Glasgow Score glasgow_alcoholic_hepatitis Alcoholic hepatitis severity FIB-4 fib4 Fibrosis estimation APRI apri Fibrosis estimation

docs.title: Nephrology Calculators
docs.text: Tools for kidney function assessment and AKI staging.

docs.title: CKD-EPI 2021 (Recommended)
docs.text:
The 2021 race-free equation.

Tool ID: ckd_epi_2021

Current Standard

CKD-EPI 2021 is now recommended over older equations

Parameters: - Serum creatinine (mg/dL) - Age (years) - Sex

CKD Staging:

Stage eGFR (mL/min/1.73m²) Description G1 ≥90 Normal or high G2 60-89 Mildly decreased G3a 45-59 Mildly to moderately decreased G3b 30-44 Moderately to severely decreased G4 15-29 Severely decreased G5 <15 Kidney failure

docs.title: Cockcroft-Gault
docs.text:
Creatinine clearance estimation (for drug dosing).

Tool ID: cockcroft_gault

Parameters: - Serum creatinine - Age - Weight - Sex

Drug Dosing

Many drug manufacturers still reference Cockcroft-Gault for dosing adjustments

docs.title: KDIGO AKI Staging
docs.text:
Tool ID: kdigo_aki

Staging Criteria:

Stage Serum Creatinine Urine Output 1 1.5-1.9× baseline OR ≥0.3 mg/dL increase <0.5 mL/kg/h for 6-12h 2 2.0-2.9× baseline <0.5 mL/kg/h for ≥12h 3 ≥3× baseline OR ≥4.0 mg/dL OR RRT <0.3 mL/kg/h for ≥24h OR anuria ≥12h

docs.title: Corrected Sodium
docs.text:
Tool ID: corrected_sodium

Corrects sodium for hyperglycemia.

Formula: Na + 1.6 × (Glucose - 100) / 100

docs.title: FENa (Fractional Excretion of Sodium)
docs.text:
Tool ID: fena

Differentiates prerenal from intrinsic renal AKI.

FENa Interpretation <1% Prerenal azotemia >2% Intrinsic renal disease 1-2% Indeterminate

docs.title: Other Nephrology Tools
docs.text: Tool ID Purpose BUN/Creatinine Ratio bun_cr_ratio Prerenal vs intrinsic Urine Anion Gap urine_anion_gap RTA differentiation Osmolar Gap osmolar_gap Toxic alcohol screen Free Water Deficit free_water_deficit Hypernatremia correction

docs.title: Neurology Calculators
docs.text: Tools for neurological assessment and prognosis.

docs.title: Glasgow Coma Scale (GCS)
docs.text:
Tool ID: glasgow_coma_scale

Component Score Response Eye Opening 4 Spontaneous 3 To voice 2 To pain 1 None Verbal 5 Oriented 4 Confused 3 Inappropriate words 2 Incomprehensible sounds 1 None Motor 6 Obeys commands 5 Localizes pain 4 Withdraws from pain 3 Flexion to pain 2 Extension to pain 1 None

Severity: - 13-15: Mild - 9-12: Moderate - 3-8: Severe (intubation often needed)

docs.title: NIHSS (NIH Stroke Scale)
docs.text:
Tool ID: nihss

15-item scale for stroke severity.

Score Severity 0 No stroke symptoms 1-4 Minor 5-15 Moderate 16-20 Moderate-severe 21-42 Severe

docs.title: Hunt & Hess Grade
docs.text:
Tool ID: hunt_hess

Clinical grading of SAH.

Grade Criteria Mortality I Asymptomatic or mild headache 1% II Moderate-severe headache, nuchal rigidity 5% III Drowsy, confused, mild focal deficit 19% IV Stupor, moderate hemiparesis 42% V Coma, decerebrate posturing 77%

docs.title: Fisher Grade
docs.text:
Tool ID: fisher_grade

CT grading for vasospasm risk.

Grade CT Findings Vasospasm Risk 1 No blood Low 2 Diffuse thin (<1mm) Low 3 Localized clot or thick (>1mm) High 4 Intraventricular/parenchymal Moderate

docs.title: ICH Score
docs.text:
Tool ID: ich_score

30-day mortality prediction for ICH.

Factor Points GCS 3-4 2 GCS 5-12 1 GCS 13-15 0 Age ≥80 1 ICH volume ≥30mL 1 Intraventricular hemorrhage 1 Infratentorial origin 1 Score 30-day Mortality 0 0% 1 13% 2 26% 3 72% 4 97% 5-6 100%

docs.title: Psychiatry Calculators
docs.text:
Validated screening and assessment tools for mental health conditions.

Clinical Use

These tools are for screening purposes. Clinical diagnosis requires comprehensive psychiatric evaluation.

docs.title: PHQ-9 (Patient Health Questionnaire-9)
docs.text:
Depression screening and severity assessment.

Tool ID: phq9

9 Questions rated 0-3 (Not at all → Nearly every day): 1. Little interest or pleasure 2. Feeling down, depressed, hopeless 3. Sleep problems 4. Feeling tired 5. Appetite changes 6. Feeling bad about yourself 7. Trouble concentrating 8. Moving/speaking slowly or restlessly 9. Thoughts of self-harm

Severity:

Score Severity Action 0-4 Minimal Monitor 5-9 Mild Watchful waiting 10-14 Moderate Treatment plan 15-19 Moderately severe Active treatment 20-27 Severe Immediate intervention

Question 9

Always assess suicide risk if Q9 > 0

docs.title: HAM-D (Hamilton Depression Rating Scale)
docs.text:
Clinician-administered depression severity assessment.

Tool ID: hamd

17-item version assessing: - Depressed mood - Guilt - Suicide - Insomnia (early, middle, late) - Work and activities - Retardation - Agitation - Anxiety (psychic, somatic) - Somatic symptoms - Hypochondriasis - Weight loss - Insight

docs.title: MADRS (Montgomery-Åsberg Depression Rating Scale)
docs.text:
Tool ID: madrs

10-item scale particularly sensitive to treatment changes.

docs.title: GAD-7 (Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7)
docs.text:
Tool ID: gad7

7 Questions rated 0-3: 1. Feeling nervous, anxious 2. Not being able to stop worrying 3. Worrying too much 4. Trouble relaxing 5. Being restless 6. Easily annoyed 7. Feeling afraid

Score Severity 0-4 Minimal 5-9 Mild 10-14 Moderate 15-21 Severe

docs.title: HAM-A (Hamilton Anxiety Rating Scale)
docs.text:
Tool ID: hama

14-item clinician-administered anxiety assessment.

docs.title: PCL-5 (PTSD Checklist for DSM-5)
docs.text:
Tool ID: pcl5

20-item self-report for PTSD symptoms.

Clusters: - Intrusion (items 1-5) - Avoidance (items 6-7) - Negative cognition/mood (items 8-14) - Arousal/reactivity (items 15-20)

Cutoff: Score ≥31-33 suggests probable PTSD

docs.title: CAPS-5 (Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale)
docs.text:
Tool ID: caps5

Gold standard structured interview for PTSD diagnosis.

30 Items assessing: - Criterion A: Trauma exposure - Criterion B: Intrusion symptoms - Criterion C: Avoidance - Criterion D: Negative alterations - Criterion E: Arousal/reactivity - Criterion F: Duration - Criterion G: Functional impairment

docs.title: Architecture
docs.text: Medical-Calc-MCP follows Domain-Driven Design (DDD) with an Onion Architecture.

docs.title: Design Principles
docs.text:
1. Domain at the Center: Business logic is isolated from infrastructure
  2. Dependency Inversion: Inner layers don't depend on outer layers
  3. Single Responsibility: Each calculator is a focused domain service

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
src/
├── domain/                    # Core business logic
│   ├── entities/              # Domain entities
│   │   ├── score_result.py    # Calculation result
│   │   └── tool_metadata.py   # Calculator metadata
│   ├── services/              # Domain services
│   │   ├── calculators/       # 121 calculator implementations
│   │   ├── base.py            # BaseCalculator abstract class
│   │   └── param_matcher.py   # Intelligent parameter matching
│   ├── value_objects/         # Immutable value types
│   │   ├── tool_keys.py       # Specialty, ClinicalContext enums
│   │   ├── units.py           # Medical units
│   │   └── interpretation.py  # Result interpretation
│   └── validation/            # Domain validation
│       └── boundaries.py      # Clinical boundary validation
│
├── application/               # Application services
│   └── use_cases/
│       ├── calculate_use_case.py
│       └── discovery_use_case.py
│
├── infrastructure/            # External interfaces
│   ├── mcp/                   # MCP protocol
│   │   ├── server.py          # FastMCP server
│   │   └── handlers/          # Tool handlers
│   └── rest/                  # REST API
│       └── server.py          # Starlette server
│
└── main.py                    # Entry point

docs.title: Calculator Pattern
docs.text:
Each calculator follows the BaseCalculator pattern:

class SofaCalculator(BaseCalculator):
    @property
    def metadata(self) -> ToolMetadata:
        return ToolMetadata(
            low_level=LowLevelKey(
                tool_id="sofa_score",
                name="SOFA Score",
                purpose="...",
                input_params=[...],
            ),
            high_level=HighLevelKey(
                specialties=(Specialty.CRITICAL_CARE,),
                conditions=("Sepsis", "Organ Dysfunction"),
                clinical_contexts=(ClinicalContext.SEVERITY_ASSESSMENT,),
            ),
            references=(Reference(citation="...", pmid="..."),),
        )

    def calculate(self, **params) -> ScoreResult:
        # Validated calculation logic
        return ScoreResult(
            value=score,
            unit=Unit.SCORE,
            interpretation=Interpretation(...),
        )

docs.title: Low-Level Key (Direct Access)
docs.text:
• tool_id: Unique identifier
  • name: Display name
  • input_params: Required parameters

docs.title: High-Level Key (Discovery)
docs.text:
• specialties: Medical specialties
  • conditions: Clinical conditions
  • clinical_contexts: Use contexts
  • keywords: Search terms

This enables both: 1. Direct tool invocation: calculate("sofa_score", ...) 2. Discovery: "Find tools for sepsis evaluation"

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: We welcome contributions to Medical-Calc-MCP!

docs.title: Getting Started
docs.text:
1. Fork the repository
  2. Clone your fork: 
    git clone https://github.com/YOUR_USERNAME/medical-calc-mcp.git
cd medical-calc-mcp
  3. Install dependencies: 
    uv sync --all-extras
uv run pre-commit install

docs.title: Running Tests
docs.text:
# All tests
uv run pytest tests/

# With coverage
uv run pytest tests/ --cov=src --cov-report=html

# Specific test file
uv run pytest tests/test_calculators.py -v

docs.title: Code Quality
docs.text:
# Linting
uv run ruff check src/

# Formatting
uv run ruff format src/

# Type checking
uv run mypy src/

docs.title: 1. Create the Calculator File
docs.text:
Create src/domain/services/calculators/your_calculator.py:

from ...entities.score_result import ScoreResult
from ...entities.tool_metadata import ToolMetadata
from ..base import BaseCalculator

class YourCalculator(BaseCalculator):
    @property
    def metadata(self) -> ToolMetadata:
        return ToolMetadata(
            low_level=LowLevelKey(
                tool_id="your_calculator",
                name="Your Calculator Name",
                purpose="Brief description",
                input_params=["param1", "param2"],
            ),
            high_level=HighLevelKey(
                specialties=(Specialty.YOUR_SPECIALTY,),
                conditions=("Condition1", "Condition2"),
                clinical_contexts=(ClinicalContext.DIAGNOSIS,),
            ),
            references=(
                Reference(
                    citation="Author et al. Journal. Year;Vol:Pages",
                    pmid="12345678",
                ),
            ),
        )

    def calculate(self, **params) -> ScoreResult:
        # Your calculation logic
        pass

docs.title: 2. Register the Calculator
docs.text:
Add to src/domain/services/calculators/__init__.py:

from .your_calculator import YourCalculator

__all__ = [
    # ... existing calculators
    "YourCalculator",
]

CALCULATORS = [
    # ... existing calculators
    YourCalculator,
]

docs.title: 3. Add Tests
docs.text: Create tests/e2e/test_your_calculator.py.

docs.title: 4. Update Test Count
docs.text: Update the expected count in: - tests/test_auto_discovery.py - tests/test_infectious_disease.py

docs.title: Pull Request Guidelines
docs.text:
1. One calculator per PR (or related group)
  2. Include tests with clinical scenarios
  3. Add references with PMID when possible
  4. Update documentation if needed
  5. Pass all checks: tests, lint, type check

docs.title: Code Style
docs.text:
• Follow existing patterns in the codebase
  • Use type hints everywhere
  • Include docstrings with parameter descriptions
  • Keep functions focused and testable

docs.title: Questions?
docs.text: Open an issue for discussion before starting large changes.

docs.title: Roadmap
docs.text: See the full ROADMAP.md for detailed plans.

docs.title: Current Status (v1.5.0)
docs.text:
• ✅ 121 Medical Calculators
  • ✅ 1,721 Tests (92% coverage)
  • ✅ MCP + REST API
  • ✅ Docker support
  • ✅ Security features (rate limiting, API key)
  • ✅ Parameter matching with fuzzy search
  • ✅ Boundary validation with literature citations

docs.title: Completed Phases
docs.text: Phase Specialty Calculators 1-15 Core specialties 75 16-19 Extended coverage 8 20-23 Oncology, Rheumatology 11 24 Psychiatry 7 25 Dermatology 5 26 Endocrinology 5 27 Urology 4 28 OB/GYN 3 30 Geriatrics 6

docs.title: Research Direction
docs.text:
We're developing an academic framework:

"Medical-Calc-MCP: A Neuro-Symbolic Framework for Reliable Clinical Reasoning"

Key contributions: 1. Clinical Knowledge Graph: Tool relationship hypergraph 2. Parameter Slot Filling: Semantic entity alignment ✅ 3. Literature-Based Constraints: Evidence-based guardrails ✅

docs.title: Contributing
docs.text: See Contributing Guide to help build the future of medical AI tools!

docs.title: Configuration
docs.text: Medical-Calc-MCP uses environment variables for configuration.

docs.title: Server Settings
docs.text: Variable Default Description HOST 0.0.0.0 Server bind address PORT 8000 Server port LOG_LEVEL INFO Logging level

docs.title: Security Settings
docs.text: Variable Default Description SECURITY_ENABLED false Enable security features SECURITY_API_KEY "" API key for authentication SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT_ENABLED false Enable rate limiting SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT_REQUESTS 100 Requests per window SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT_WINDOW 60 Window in seconds

docs.title: CORS Settings
docs.text: Variable Default Description CORS_ORIGINS * Allowed origins CORS_METHODS * Allowed HTTP methods

docs.title: Development
docs.text:
export LOG_LEVEL=DEBUG
export SECURITY_ENABLED=false
uv run python -m src.rest_server

docs.title: Production
docs.text:
export LOG_LEVEL=WARNING
export SECURITY_ENABLED=true
export SECURITY_API_KEY="your-secure-api-key"
export SECURITY_RATE_LIMIT_ENABLED=true
export CORS_ORIGINS="https://your-app.com"
uv run python -m src.rest_server

docs.title: Docker Compose
docs.text:
version: '3.8'
services:
  medical-calc:
    image: ghcr.io/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp:latest
    ports:
      - "8000:8000"
    environment:
      - LOG_LEVEL=INFO
      - SECURITY_ENABLED=true
      - SECURITY_API_KEY=${API_KEY}

docs.title: Requirements
docs.text: Requirement Version Python 3.11+ OS Windows, macOS, Linux

docs.title: Method 1: uv (Recommended)
docs.text:
uv is a fast Python package manager.

# Install uv
curl -LsSf https://astral.sh/uv/install.sh | sh

# Clone and install
git clone https://github.com/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp.git
cd medical-calc-mcp
uv sync

docs.title: Method 2: pip
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp.git
cd medical-calc-mcp
python -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate  # Windows: .venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

docs.title: Method 3: Docker
docs.text:
# Pull from GitHub Container Registry
docker pull ghcr.io/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp:latest

# Or build locally
docker build -t medical-calc-mcp .

docs.title: Verify Installation
docs.text:
# Run tests
uv run pytest tests/ -q

# Check version
uv run python -c "from src import __version__; print(__version__)"

Expected output: 1.5.0

docs.title: Development Installation
docs.text:
For contributing or development:

uv sync --all-extras
uv run pre-commit install

docs.title: Quick Start
docs.text: Get up and running with Medical-Calc-MCP in minutes.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
• Python 3.11+
  • uv (recommended) or pip

docs.title: Option 1: Clone Repository
docs.text:
git clone https://github.com/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp.git
cd medical-calc-mcp
uv sync

docs.title: Option 2: Docker
docs.text: docker pull ghcr.io/u9401066/medical-calc-mcp:latest

docs.title: MCP Mode (for AI Agents)
docs.text: uv run python -m src.main

docs.title: REST API Mode
docs.text:
uv run python -m src.rest_server

Server runs at http://localhost:8000

docs.title: Using MCP Tools
docs.text:
Once connected to an AI agent, you can use natural language:

"Calculate the CKD-EPI eGFR for a 65-year-old male with creatinine 1.2 mg/dL"

docs.title: Using REST API
docs.text:
curl -X POST http://localhost:8000/api/v1/calculate/ckd_epi_2021 \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  -d '{"serum_creatinine": 1.2, "age": 65, "sex": "male"}'

docs.title: Next Steps
docs.text:
• Installation Details - Advanced setup options
  • Configuration - Environment variables
  • Calculator Reference - Browse all 121 calculators

docs.title: Medical Calculator MCP Server
docs.text: 🏥 121 個經驗證的醫學計算器，專為 AI Agent 設計

docs.title: 什麼是 Medical-Calc-MCP？
docs.text:
Medical-Calc-MCP 是一個 Model Context Protocol (MCP) 伺服器，提供 121 個經過驗證的醫學計算器，供 Claude、GPT 等 AI 代理使用。

臨床免責聲明

本工具僅供教育和研究用途。請務必以臨床判斷和機構規範驗證計算結果。

docs.title: ✨ 主要特色
docs.text:
• 121 個臨床計算器：涵蓋 16+ 醫學專科
  • MCP 原生整合：使用 FastMCP SDK 開發
  • 智慧工具發現：兩層式 Key 系統
  • 邊界驗證：文獻支持的臨床範圍檢查

docs.title: Claude Desktop 設定
docs.text:
編輯 claude_desktop_config.json：

{
  "mcpServers": {
    "medical-calc": {
      "command": "uv",
      "args": ["run", "--directory", "/path/to/medical-calc-mcp", "python", "-m", "src.main"]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: VS Code Copilot 設定
docs.text:
編輯 .vscode/mcp.json：

{
  "servers": {
    "medical-calc": {
      "type": "stdio",
      "command": "uv",
      "args": ["run", "--directory", "${workspaceFolder}", "python", "-m", "src.main"]
    }
  }
}

docs.title: 📊 專科涵蓋
docs.text: 專科 計算器數量 範例 重症加護 15+ SOFA, APACHE II, qSOFA 心臟科 12+ CHA₂DS₂-VASc, HEART 腎臟科 8+ CKD-EPI, KDIGO AKI 麻醉科 10+ ASA-PS, Mallampati 精神科 7 PHQ-9, GAD-7 老年醫學 6 MMSE, MoCA, Barthel
